> This all feels like it should be much more direct from orbit-stabilizer-like theorems. Maybe @tb65536 has thoughts here?

Here's an orbit-stabilizer approach:
```
theorem index_stabilizer (G : Type*) {X : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G X] (x : X) :
    (MulAction.stabilizer G x).index = (orbit G x).ncard :=
  (Nat.card_congr (orbitEquivQuotientStabilizer G x)).symm.trans
    (Set.Nat.card_coe_set_eq (orbit G x))

theorem index_stabilizer' (G : Type*) {X : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G X] [IsPretransitive G X]
    (x : X) : (MulAction.stabilizer G x).index = Nat.card X := by
  rw [index_stabilizer, orbit_eq_univ, Set.ncard_univ]

theorem ncard_block_eq_relindex {x : X} (hx : x  B) :
    B.ncard = (stabilizer G x).relindex (stabilizer G B) := by
  have key : (stabilizer G x).subgroupOf (stabilizer G B) = stabilizer (stabilizer G B) x := by
    ext; rfl
  rw [Subgroup.relindex, key, index_stabilizer, hB.orbit_stabilizer_eq hx]

theorem ncard_block_mul_ncard_orbit_eq (hB_ne : B.Nonempty) :
    Set.ncard B * Set.ncard (orbit G B) = Nat.card X := by
  obtain x, hx := hB_ne
  rw [ncard_block_eq_relindex hB hx,  index_stabilizer,
      Subgroup.relindex_mul_index (hB.stabilizer_le hx), index_stabilizer']
```

I think it is necessary. If you start the proof with the reversible steps
```
  rw [mk_subset]
  intro g x h1 h2 y h3
  obtain gx, rfl := exists_smul_eq G a x
  obtain gy, rfl := exists_smul_eq G a y
  simp only [Set.mem_smul_set_iff_inv_smul_mem, Set.mem_iInter] at h1 h2 h3 
```
then you get the goal state
```
B : Set X
a : X
g gx gy : G
h1 :  (i : G), i  a  B  i  gx  a  B
h2 :  (i : G), i  a  B  i  g  gx  a  B
h3 :  (i : G), i  a  B  i  g  gy  a  B
  (i : G), i  a  B  i  gy  a  B
```
which cannot be proven without further assumptions: `h1` lets you right-multiply by `gx`, `h2` lets you right-multiply by `g * gx`, `h3` lets you right-multiply by `g * gy`, but together these do not let you right-multiply by `gy`. You need some sort of finiteness or periodicity so that you can (for instance) right multiply by `gx * (g * gx) * (g * gy)`.

I think a counterexample might be `G = ` acting on `` by translation, `B = `, and `a = 0`.

source.title: feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Iwasawa): the Iwasawa criterion for simplicity

nodes.body: This all feels like it should be much more direct from orbit-stabilizer-like theorems. Maybe @tb65536 has thoughts here?

> This all feels like it should be much more direct from orbit-stabilizer-like theorems. Maybe @tb65536 has thoughts here?

Here's an orbit-stabilizer approach:
```
theorem index_stabilizer (G : Type*) {X : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G X] (x : X) :
    (MulAction.stabilizer G x).index = (orbit G x).ncard :=
  (Nat.card_congr (orbitEquivQuotientStabilizer G x)).symm.trans
    (Set.Nat.card_coe_set_eq (orbit G x))

theorem index_stabilizer' (G : Type*) {X : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G X] [IsPretransitive G X]
    (x : X) : (MulAction.stabilizer G x).index = Nat.card X := by
  rw [index_stabilizer, orbit_eq_univ, Set.ncard_univ]

theorem ncard_block_eq_relindex {x : X} (hx : x  B) :
    B.ncard = (stabilizer G x).relindex (stabilizer G B) := by
  have key : (stabilizer G x).subgroupOf (stabilizer G B) = stabilizer (stabilizer G B) x := by
    ext; rfl
  rw [Subgroup.relindex, key, index_stabilizer, hB.orbit_stabilizer_eq hx]

theorem ncard_block_mul_ncard_orbit_eq (hB_ne : B.Nonempty) :
    Set.ncard B * Set.ncard (orbit G B) = Nat.card X := by
  obtain x, hx := hB_ne
  rw [ncard_block_eq_relindex hB hx,  index_stabilizer,
      Subgroup.relindex_mul_index (hB.stabilizer_le hx), index_stabilizer']
```
